   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of traffic between two Diameter nodes, one client, one server.
   23: %% The traffic isn't meant to be sensible, just to exercise code.
   24: %%
   25: 
   26: -module(diameter_traffic_SUITE).
   27: 
   28: %% all tests, no common_test dependency
   29: -export([run/0,
   30:          run/1]).
   31: 
   32: %% common_test wrapping
   33: -export([suite/0,
   34:          all/0,
   35:          parallel/1]).
   36: 
   37: %% testcases
   38: -export([send_ok/1,
   39:          send_nok/1,
   40:          send_eval/1,
   41:          send_bad_answer/1,
   42:          send_protocol_error/1,
   43:          send_experimental_result/1,
   44:          send_arbitrary/1,
   45:          send_proxy_info/1,
   46:          send_unknown/1,
   47:          send_unknown_short/1,
   48:          send_unknown_mandatory/1,
   49:          send_unknown_short_mandatory/1,
   50:          send_noreply/1,
   51:          send_grouped_error/1,
   52:          send_unsupported/1,
   53:          send_unsupported_app/1,
   54:          send_error_bit/1,
   55:          send_unsupported_version/1,
   56:          send_long_avp_length/1,
   57:          send_short_avp_length/1,
   58:          send_zero_avp_length/1,
   59:          send_invalid_avp_length/1,
   60:          send_invalid_reject/1,
   61:          send_unexpected_mandatory_decode/1,
   62:          send_unexpected_mandatory/1,
   63:          send_too_many/1,
   64:          send_long/1,
   65:          send_maxlen/1,
   66:          send_nopeer/1,
   67:          send_noapp/1,
   68:          send_discard/1,
   69:          send_any_1/1,
   70:          send_any_2/1,
   71:          send_all_1/1,
   72:          send_all_2/1,
   73:          send_timeout/1,
   74:          send_error/1,
   75:          send_detach/1,
   76:          send_encode_error/1,
   77:          send_destination_1/1,
   78:          send_destination_2/1,
   79:          send_destination_3/1,
   80:          send_destination_4/1,
   81:          send_destination_5/1,
   82:          send_destination_6/1,
   83:          send_destination_7/1,
   84:          send_bad_option_1/1,
   85:          send_bad_option_2/1,
   86:          send_bad_filter_1/1,
   87:          send_bad_filter_2/1,
   88:          send_bad_filter_3/1,
   89:          send_bad_filter_4/1,
   90:          send_multiple_filters_1/1,
   91:          send_multiple_filters_2/1,
   92:          send_multiple_filters_3/1,
   93:          send_anything/1]).
   94: 
   95: %% diameter callbacks
   96: -export([peer_up/4,
   97:          peer_down/4,
   98:          pick_peer/7, pick_peer/8,
   99:          prepare_request/6, prepare_request/7,
  100:          prepare_retransmit/6,
  101:          handle_answer/7, handle_answer/8,
  102:          handle_error/7,
  103:          handle_request/4]).
  104: 
  105: %% diameter_{tcp,sctp} callbacks
  106: -export([message/3]).
  107: 
  108: -include_lib("kernel/include/inet_sctp.hrl").
  109: 
  110: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
  111: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_rfc3588.hrl").
  112: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_accounting.hrl").
  113: %% The listening transports use RFC 3588 dictionaries, the client
  114: %% transports use either 3588 or 6733. (So can't use the record
  115: %% definitions in the latter case.)
  116: 
  117: %% ===========================================================================
  118: 
  119: -define(util, diameter_util).
  120: 
  121: -define(A, list_to_atom).
  122: -define(L, atom_to_list).
  123: -define(B, iolist_to_binary).
  124: 
  125: %% Don't use is_record/2 since dictionary hrl's aren't included.
  126: %% (Since they define conflicting records with the same names.)
  127: -define(is_record(Rec, Name), (Name == element(1, Rec))).
  128: 
  129: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
  130: 
  131: -define(REALM, "erlang.org").
  132: -define(HOST(Host, Realm), Host ++ [$.|Realm]).
  133: 
  134: -define(EXTRA, an_extra_argument).
  135: 
  136: %% Sequence mask for End-to-End and Hop-by-Hop identifiers.
  137: -define(CLIENT_MASK, {1,26}).  %% 1 in top 6 bits
  138: 
  139: %% How to construct outgoing messages.
  140: -define(ENCODINGS, [list, record, map]).
  141: 
  142: %% How to decode incoming messages.
  143: -define(DECODINGS, [record, none, map, list, record_from_map]).
  144: 
  145: %% Which dictionary to use in the clients.
  146: -define(RFCS, [rfc3588, rfc6733, rfc4005]).
  147: 
  148: %% Which transport protocol to use.
  149: -define(TRANSPORTS, [sctp || ?util:have_sctp()] ++ [tcp]).
  150: 
  151: -record(group, {transport,
  152:                 strings,
  153:                 encoding,
  154:                 client_service,
  155:                 client_dict,
  156:                 client_sender,
  157:                 server_service,
  158:                 server_decoding,
  159:                 server_sender,
  160:                 server_throttle}).
  161: 
  162: %% Not really what we should be setting unless the message is sent in
  163: %% the common application but diameter doesn't care.
  164: -define(APP_ID, ?DIAMETER_APP_ID_COMMON).
  165: 
  166: %% An Application-ID the server doesn't support.
  167: -define(BAD_APP, 42).
  168: 
  169: %% A common match when receiving answers in a client.
  170: -define(answer_message(SessionId, ResultCode),
  171:         ['answer-message' | #{'Session-Id' := SessionId,
  172:                               'Origin-Host' := _,
  173:                               'Origin-Realm' := _,
  174:                               'Result-Code' := ResultCode}]).
  175: -define(answer_message(ResultCode),
  176:         ['answer-message' | #{'Origin-Host' := _,
  177:                               'Origin-Realm' := _,
  178:                               'Result-Code' := ResultCode}]).
  179: 
  180: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
  181: -define(SERVICE(Name, Grp),
  182:         [{'Origin-Host', Name ++ "." ++ ?REALM},
  183:          {'Origin-Realm', ?REALM},
  184:          {'Host-IP-Address', [?ADDR]},
  185:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
  186:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
  187:          {'Auth-Application-Id', [0]},  %% common messages
  188:          {'Acct-Application-Id', [3]},  %% base accounting
  189:          {restrict_connections, false},
  190:          {string_decode, Grp#group.strings},
  191:          {avp_dictionaries, [diameter_gen_doic_rfc7683]},
  192:          {incoming_maxlen, 1 bsl 21}
  193:          | [{application, [{dictionary, D},
  194:                            {module, [?MODULE, Grp]},
  195:                            {answer_errors, callback}]}
  196:             || D <- [diameter_gen_base_rfc3588,
  197:                      diameter_gen_base_accounting,
  198:                      diameter_gen_base_rfc6733,
  199:                      diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733,
  200:                      nas4005],
  201:                D /= nas4005 orelse have_nas()]]).
  202: 
  203: -define(SUCCESS,
  204:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_SUCCESS').
  205: -define(COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED,
  206:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED').
  207: -define(TOO_BUSY,
  208:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_TOO_BUSY').
  209: -define(APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED,
  210:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED').
  211: -define(INVALID_HDR_BITS,
  212:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_INVALID_HDR_BITS').
  213: -define(INVALID_AVP_BITS,
  214:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_INVALID_AVP_BITS').
  215: -define(AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  216:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_AVP_UNSUPPORTED').
  217: -define(UNSUPPORTED_VERSION,
  218:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_UNSUPPORTED_VERSION').
  219: -define(TOO_MANY,
  220:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_AVP_OCCURS_TOO_MANY_TIMES').
  221: -define(REALM_NOT_SERVED,
  222:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_REALM_NOT_SERVED').
  223: -define(UNABLE_TO_DELIVER,
  224:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_UNABLE_TO_DELIVER').
  225: -define(INVALID_AVP_LENGTH,
  226:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_INVALID_AVP_LENGTH').
  227: 
  228: -define(EVENT_RECORD,
  229:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_ACCOUNTING-RECORD-TYPE_EVENT_RECORD').
  230: -define(AUTHORIZE_ONLY,
  231:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RE-AUTH-REQUEST-TYPE_AUTHORIZE_ONLY').
  232: -define(AUTHORIZE_AUTHENTICATE,
  233:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RE-AUTH-REQUEST-TYPE_AUTHORIZE_AUTHENTICATE').
  234: 
  235: -define(LOGOUT,
  236:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_LOGOUT').
  237: -define(BAD_ANSWER,
  238:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_BAD_ANSWER').
  239: -define(USER_MOVED,
  240:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_USER_MOVED').
  241: 
  242: %% ===========================================================================
  243: %% common_test wrapping
  244: 
  245: suite() ->
  246:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 90}}].
  247: 
  248: all() ->
  249:     [parallel].
  250: 
  251: parallel(_Config) ->
  252:     run().
  253: 
  254: %% ===========================================================================
  255: 
  256: %% run/0
  257: %%
  258: %% The test cases proper, do or (meaningfully) die.
  259: %%
  260: %% Randomly choose one of many configuration possibilities. Testing
  261: %% all of them takes too much time, and randomly skipping various
  262: %% cases (as used to be the case) just unnecessary complexity. There
  263: %% are run night after night in on various hosts, so just choosing a
  264: %% configuration results in sufficient coverage over time.
  265: 
  266: run() ->
  267:     %% ok = logger:set_primary_config(level, debug),
  268:     Svc = ?util:unique_string(),
  269:     run(#group{transport = ?util:choose(?TRANSPORTS),
  270:                strings = bool(),
  271:                encoding = ?util:choose(?ENCODINGS),
  272:                client_service = [$C | Svc],
  273:                client_dict = appdict(?util:choose(?RFCS)),
  274:                client_sender = bool(),
  275:                server_service = [$S | Svc],
  276:                server_decoding = ?util:choose(?DECODINGS),
  277:                server_sender = true,  %% avoid deadlock
  278:                server_throttle = bool()}).
  279: 
  280: %% run/1
  281: 
  282: run(#group{} = Cfg) ->
  283:     _ = result_codes(Cfg),
  284:     io:format("config: ~p~n", [Cfg]),
  285:     try
  286:         ?util:run([{[fun traffic/1, Cfg], 60000}])
  287:     after
  288:         code:delete(nas4005),
  289:         code:purge(nas4005),
  290:         diameter:stop()
  291:     end.
  292: 
  293: %% traffic/1
  294: 
  295: traffic(#group{} = Cfg) ->
  296:     _ = compile_and_load(),
  297:     ok = diameter:start(),
  298:     LRef = server(Cfg),
  299:     ok = client(Cfg, LRef),
  300:     [] = send(Cfg),
  301: 
  302:     print_services_info(),
  303: 
  304:     ok = stop_services(Cfg),
  305:     [] = ets:tab2list(diameter_request).
  306: 
  307: 
  308: print_services_info() ->
  309:     print_services_info(diameter:services()).
  310: 
  311: print_services_info([]) ->
  312:     io:format("~n", []);
  313: print_services_info([Service | Services]) ->
  314:     io:format("~n   Service: ~s"
  315:               "~n      Config:"
  316:               "~n         ~p"
  317:               "~n      Which Connections:"
  318:               "~n         ~p"
  319:               "~n      Which Connections/Service:"
  320:               "~n         ~p"
  321:               "~n      Which Watchdogs:"
  322:               "~n         ~p"
  323:               "~n      Which Watchdogs/Service:"
  324:               "~n         ~p"
  325:               "~n      Which Transports:"
  326:               "~n         ~p"
  327:               "~n      Which Transports/Service:"
  328:               "~n         ~p"
  329:               "~n      Peers Info:"
  330:               "~n         ~p"
  331:               "~n      Transport Info:"
  332:               "~n         ~p"
  333:               "~n      All info:"
  334:               "~n         ~p",
  335:               [Service,
  336:                diameter_config:lookup(Service),
  337:                diameter:which_connections(),
  338:                diameter:which_connections(Service),
  339:                diameter:which_watchdogs(),
  340:                diameter:which_watchdogs(Service),
  341:                diameter:which_transports(),
  342:                diameter:which_transports(Service),
  343:                diameter:service_info(Service, peers),
  344:                diameter:service_info(Service, transport),
  345:                diameter:service_info(Service, all)]),
  346:     print_services_info(Services).
  347: 
  348: 
  349: %% start_service/2
  350: 
  351: start_service(Svc, Opts) ->
  352:     {ok, _} = {diameter:start_service(Svc, Opts), Opts},
  353:     ok.
  354: 
  355: %% send/1
  356: 
  357: send(Cfg) ->
  358:     Ref = make_ref(),
  359:     Refs = [R || {F,1} <- module_info(exports),
  360:                  "send_" ++ _ <- [atom_to_list(F)],
  361:                  I <- [fun() -> exit({Ref, send(F, Cfg)}) end],
  362:                  {_,R} <- [spawn_monitor(I)]],
  363:     lists:filter(fun({R,_}) -> R /= Ref; (_) -> true end, wait(Refs)).
  364: 
  365: %% send/2
  366: 
  367: send(F, #group{transport = sctp})
  368:   when F == send_long;
  369:        F == send_maxlen ->
  370:     ok;
  371: 
  372: send(F, Cfg) ->
  373:     timer:sleep(rand:uniform(2000)),
  374:     apply(?MODULE, F, [[{testcase, F}, {group, Cfg}]]).
  375: 
  376: %% wait/1
  377: 
  378: wait(Refs)
  379:   when is_list(Refs) ->
  380:     lists:map(fun wait/1, Refs);
  381: 
  382: wait(MRef) ->
  383:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, _, T} -> T end.
  384: 
  385: %% ===========================================================================
  386: 
  387: %% server/1
  388: 
  389: server(Config) ->
  390: 
  391:     logger:debug("entry with"
  392:                  "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  393: 
  394:     #group{transport = T,
  395:            client_sender = CS,
  396:            server_service = SN,
  397:            server_decoding = SD,
  398:            server_sender = SS,
  399:            server_throttle = ST}
  400:         = Grp
  401:         = group(Config),
  402:     ok = start_service(SN, [{traffic_counters, bool()},
  403:                             {decode_format, SD},
  404:                             {bins_info, bins_info()}
  405:                             | ?SERVICE(SN, Grp)]),
  406:     Cfg = [{sender, SS},
  407:            {message_cb, ST andalso {?MODULE, message, [0]}}]
  408:         ++ [{packet, ?util:choose([false, raw])} || T == sctp andalso CS]
  409:         ++ [{unordered, unordered()} || T == sctp],
  410:     Opts = [{capabilities_cb, fun capx/2},
  411:             {pool_size, 8}
  412:            | server_apps()],
  413:     _LRef = ?util:listen(SN, [T | Cfg], Opts).
  414: 
  415: %% client/1
  416: 
  417: client(Config, LRef) ->
  418: 
  419:     logger:debug("entry with"
  420:                  "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  421: 
  422:     #group{transport = T,
  423:            encoding = E,
  424:            client_service = CN,
  425:            client_sender = CS}
  426:         = Grp
  427:         = group(Config),
  428:     ok = start_service(CN, [{traffic_counters, bool()},
  429:                             {sequence, ?CLIENT_MASK},
  430:                             {decode_format, map},
  431:                             {strict_arities, decode},
  432:                             {bins_info, bins_info()}
  433:                             | ?SERVICE(CN, Grp)]),
  434:     _ = [?util:connect(CN, [T | C], LRef, O)
  435:          || C <- [[{sender, CS} | client_opts(T)]],
  436:             D <- ?DECODINGS,  %% for multiple candidate peers
  437:             R <- ?RFCS,
  438:             R /= rfc4005 orelse have_nas(),
  439:             I <- [{D,E}],
  440:             O <- [[{id, I}
  441:                   | client_apps(R, [{'Origin-State-Id', origin(I)}])]]],
  442:     ok.
  443: 
  444: bool() ->
  445:     0.5 =< rand:uniform().
  446: 
  447: bins_info() ->
  448:     %% Three possibilities: true | false | non_neg_integer()
  449:     %% We choose a low range, 42, only because our test does not
  450:     %% actually stress the system, so no point in picking a large
  451:     %% number.
  452:     ?util:choose([true, false, rand:uniform(42)]).
  453: 
  454: unordered() ->
  455:     ?util:choose([true, false, 1, 2]).
  456: 
  457: client_opts(tcp) ->
  458:     [];
  459: client_opts(sctp) ->
  460:     [{unordered, unordered()}
  461:      | [{sctp_initmsg, #sctp_initmsg{num_ostreams = N,
  462:                                      max_instreams = 5}}
  463:         || N <- [rand:uniform(8)],
  464:            N =< 6]].
  465: 
  466: server_apps() ->
  467:     B = have_nas(),
  468:     [{applications, [diameter_gen_base_rfc3588,
  469:                      diameter_gen_base_accounting]
  470:                     ++ [nas4005 || B]},
  471:      {capabilities, [{'Auth-Application-Id', [0] ++ [1 || B]}, %% common, NAS
  472:                      {'Acct-Application-Id', [3]}]}].          %% accounting
  473: 
  474: client_apps(rfc4005, Caps) ->
  475:     [{applications, [nas4005]},
  476:      {capabilities, [{'Auth-Application-Id', [1]},     %% NAS
  477:                      {'Acct-Application-Id', []}
  478:                     | Caps]}];
  479: client_apps(D, Caps) ->
  480:     D0 = dict0(D),
  481:     [{applications, [acct(D0), D0]},
  482:      {capabilities, Caps}].
  483: 
  484: have_nas() ->
  485:     false /= code:is_loaded(nas4005).
  486: 
  487: stop_services(Config) ->
  488:     #group{client_service = CN,
  489:            server_service = SN}
  490:         = group(Config),
  491:     ok = diameter:stop_service(CN),
  492:     ok = diameter:stop_service(SN).
  493: 
  494: capx(_, #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH,DH}}) ->
  495:     io:format("connection: ~p -> ~p~n", [DH,OH]),
  496:     ok.
  497: 
  498: %% ===========================================================================
  499: 
  500: %% Ensure that result codes have the expected values.
  501: result_codes(_Config) ->
  502:     {2001,
  503:      3001, 3002, 3003, 3004, 3007, 3008, 3009,
  504:      5001, 5009, 5011, 5014}
  505:         = {?SUCCESS,
  506:            ?COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED,
  507:            ?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER,
  508:            ?REALM_NOT_SERVED,
  509:            ?TOO_BUSY,
  510:            ?APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED,
  511:            ?INVALID_HDR_BITS,
  512:            ?INVALID_AVP_BITS,
  513:            ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  514:            ?TOO_MANY,
  515:            ?UNSUPPORTED_VERSION,
  516:            ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH}.
  517: 
  518: %% Send an ACR and expect success.
  519: send_ok(Config) ->
  520:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  521:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 1}],
  522:     ['ACA' | #{'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  523:                'Session-Id' := _}]
  524:         = call(Config, Req).
  525: 
  526: %% Send an accounting ACR that the server answers badly to.
  527: send_nok(Config) ->
  528:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  529:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 0}],
  530: 
  531:     ?answer_message(?INVALID_AVP_BITS)
  532:         = call(Config, Req).
  533: 
  534: %% Send an ACR and expect success.
  535: send_eval(Config) ->
  536:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  537:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 3}],
  538: 
  539:     ['ACA' | #{'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  540:                'Session-Id' := _}]
  541:         = call(Config, Req).
  542: 
  543: %% Send an accounting ACR that the server tries to answer with an
  544: %% inappropriate header. That the error is detected is coded in
  545: %% handle_answer.
  546: send_bad_answer(Config) ->
  547:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  548:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 2}],
  549:     ?answer_message(?SUCCESS)
  550:         = call(Config, Req).
  551: 
  552: %% Send an ACR that the server callback answers explicitly with a
  553: %% protocol error and some AVPs to check the decoding of.
  554: send_protocol_error(Config) ->
  555:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  556:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 4}],
  557: 
  558:     ['answer-message' | #{'Result-Code' := ?TOO_BUSY,
  559:                           'AVP' := [OLR | _]} = Avps]
  560:         = call(Config, Req),
  561: 
  562:     #diameter_avp{name = 'OC-OLR',
  563:                   value = #{'OC-Sequence-Number' := 1,
  564:                             'OC-Report-Type' := 0,  %% HOST_REPORT
  565:                             'OC-Reduction-Percentage' := [25],
  566:                             'OC-Validity-Duration' := [60],
  567:                             'AVP' := [OSF]}}
  568:         = OLR,
  569:     #diameter_avp{name = 'OC-Supported-Features',
  570:                   value = #{} = Fs}
  571:         = OSF,
  572:     0 = maps:size(Fs),
  573: 
  574:     #group{client_dict = D} = group(Config), 
  575: 
  576:     if D == nas4005 ->
  577:             error = maps:find('Failed-AVP', Avps),
  578:             #{'AVP' := [_,Failed]}
  579:                 = Avps,
  580:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Failed-AVP',
  581:                           value = #{'AVP' := [NP,FR,AP]}}
  582:                 = Failed,
  583:             #diameter_avp{name = 'NAS-Port',
  584:                           value = 44}
  585:                 = NP,
  586:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision',
  587:                           value = 12}
  588:                 = FR,
  589:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period',
  590:                           value = 13}
  591:                 = AP;
  592: 
  593:        D == diameter_gen_base_rfc3588;
  594:        D == diameter_gen_basr_accounting ->
  595:             error = maps:find('Failed-AVP', Avps),
  596:             #{'AVP' := [_,Failed]}
  597:                 = Avps,
  598: 
  599:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Failed-AVP',
  600:                            value = #{'AVP' := [NP,FR,AP]}}
  601:                 = Failed,
  602:             #diameter_avp{name = undefined,
  603:                           value = undefined}
  604:                 = NP,
  605:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision',
  606:                           value = 12}
  607:                 = FR,
  608:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period',
  609:                           value = 13}
  610:                 = AP;
  611: 
  612:        D == diameter_gen_base_rfc6733;
  613:        D == diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733 ->
  614:             #{'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [NP,FR,AP]}],
  615:               'AVP' := [_]}
  616:                 = Avps,
  617:             #diameter_avp{name = undefined,
  618:                           value = undefined}
  619:                 = NP,
  620:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision',
  621:                           value = 12}
  622:                 = FR,
  623:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period',
  624:                           value = 13}
  625:                 = AP
  626:     end.
  627: 
  628: %% Send a 3xxx Experimental-Result in an answer not setting the E-bit
  629: %% and missing a Result-Code.
  630: send_experimental_result(Config) ->
  631:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  632:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 5}],
  633:     ['ACA' | #{'Session-Id' := _}]
  634:         = call(Config, Req).
  635: 
  636: %% Send an ASR with an arbitrary non-mandatory AVP and expect success
  637: %% and the same AVP in the reply.
  638: send_arbitrary(Config) ->
  639:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{name = 'Product-Name',
  640:                                          value = "XXX"}]}],
  641:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  642:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  643:                'AVP' := [#diameter_avp{name = 'Product-Name',
  644:                                        value = V}]}]
  645:         = call(Config, Req),
  646:     "XXX" = string(V, Config).
  647: 
  648: %% Send Proxy-Info in an ASR that the peer answers with 3xxx, and
  649: %% ensure that the AVP is returned.
  650: send_proxy_info(Config) ->
  651:     H0 = ?B(?util:unique_string()),
  652:     S0 = ?B(?util:unique_string()),
  653:     Req = ['ASR', {'Proxy-Info', #{'Proxy-Host'  => H0,
  654:                                    'Proxy-State' => S0}}],
  655:     ['answer-message' | #{'Result-Code' := 3999,
  656:                           'Proxy-Info' := [#{'Proxy-Host' := H,
  657:                                              'Proxy-State' := S}]}]
  658:         = call(Config, Req),
  659:     [H0, S0] = [?B(X) || X <- [H,S]].
  660: 
  661: %% Send an unknown AVP (to some client) and check that it comes back.
  662: send_unknown(Config) ->
  663:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  664:                                          is_mandatory = false,
  665:                                          data = <<17>>}]}],
  666:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  667:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  668:                'AVP' := [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  669:                                        is_mandatory = false,
  670:                                        data = <<17>>}]}]
  671:         = call(Config, Req).
  672: 
  673: %% Ditto, and point the AVP length past the end of the message. Expect
  674: %% 5014.
  675: send_unknown_short(Config) ->
  676:     send_unknown_short(Config, false, ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH).
  677: 
  678: send_unknown_short(Config, M, RC) ->
  679:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  680:                                          is_mandatory = M,
  681:                                          data = <<17>>}]}],
  682:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  683:                'Result-Code' := RC,
  684:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  685:         = call(Config, Req),
  686:     #diameter_avp{code = 999,
  687:                   is_mandatory = M,
  688:                   data = <<17, _/binary>>} %% extra bits from padding
  689:         = Avp.
  690: 
  691: %% Ditto but set the M flag.
  692: send_unknown_mandatory(Config) ->
  693:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  694:                                          is_mandatory = true,
  695:                                          data = <<17>>}]}],
  696:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  697:                'Result-Code' := ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  698:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  699:         = call(Config, Req),
  700:     #diameter_avp{code = 999,
  701:                   is_mandatory = true,
  702:                   data = <<17>>}
  703:         = Avp.
  704: 
  705: %% Ditto, and point the AVP length past the end of the message. Expect
  706: %% 5014 instead of 5001.
  707: send_unknown_short_mandatory(Config) ->
  708:     send_unknown_short(Config, true, ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH).
  709: 
  710: %% Send an ASR containing an unexpected mandatory Session-Timeout.
  711: %% Expect 5001, and check that the value in Failed-AVP was decoded.
  712: send_unexpected_mandatory_decode(Config) ->
  713:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 27,  %% Session-Timeout
  714:                                          is_mandatory = true,
  715:                                          data = <<12:32>>}]}],
  716:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  717:                'Result-Code' := ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  718:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  719:         = call(Config, Req),
  720:     #diameter_avp{code = 27,
  721:                   is_mandatory = true,
  722:                   value = 12,
  723:                   data = <<12:32>>}
  724:         = Avp.
  725: 
  726: %% Try to two Auth-Application-Id in ASR expect 5009.
  727: send_too_many(Config) ->
  728:     Req = ['ASR', {'Auth-Application-Id', [?APP_ID, 44]}],
  729: 
  730:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  731:                'Result-Code' := ?TOO_MANY,
  732:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  733:         = call(Config, Req),
  734:     #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Application-Id',
  735:                   value = 44}
  736:         = Avp.
  737: 
  738: %% Send an containing a faulty Grouped AVP (empty Proxy-Host in
  739: %% Proxy-Info) and expect that only the faulty AVP is sent in
  740: %% Failed-AVP. The encoded values of Proxy-Host and Proxy-State are
  741: %% swapped in prepare_request since an empty Proxy-Host is an encode
  742: %% error.
  743: send_grouped_error(Config) ->
  744:     Req = ['ASR', {'Proxy-Info', [[{'Proxy-Host', "abcd"},
  745:                                    {'Proxy-State', ""}]]}],
  746:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  747:                'Result-Code' := ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH,
  748:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  749:         = call(Config, Req),
  750:     #diameter_avp{name = 'Proxy-Info', value = #{'Proxy-Host' := H}}
  751:         = Avp,
  752:     <<0>> = ?B(H).
  753: 
  754: %% Send an STR that the server ignores.
  755: send_noreply(Config) ->
  756:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  757:     {timeout, _} = call(Config, Req).
  758: 
  759: %% Send an unsupported command and expect 3001.
  760: send_unsupported(Config) ->
  761:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  762:     ?answer_message(?COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED)
  763:         = call(Config, Req).
  764: 
  765: %% Send an unsupported application and expect 3007.
  766: send_unsupported_app(Config) ->
  767:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  768:     ?answer_message(?APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED)
  769:         = call(Config, Req).
  770: 
  771: %% Send a request with the E bit set and expect 3008.
  772: send_error_bit(Config) ->
  773:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  774:     ?answer_message(?INVALID_HDR_BITS)
  775:         = call(Config, Req).
  776: 
  777: %% Send a bad version and check that we get 5011.
  778: send_unsupported_version(Config) ->
  779:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  780:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  781:                'Result-Code' := ?UNSUPPORTED_VERSION}]
  782:         = call(Config, Req).
  783: 
  784: %% Send a request containing an AVP length > data size.
  785: send_long_avp_length(Config) ->
  786:     send_invalid_avp_length(Config).
  787: 
  788: %% Send a request containing an AVP length < data size.
  789: send_short_avp_length(Config) ->
  790:     send_invalid_avp_length(Config).
  791: 
  792: %% Send a request containing an AVP whose advertised length is < 8.
  793: send_zero_avp_length(Config) ->
  794:     send_invalid_avp_length(Config).
  795: 
  796: %% Send a request containing an AVP length that doesn't match the
  797: %% AVP's type.
  798: send_invalid_avp_length(Config) ->
  799:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  800: 
  801:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  802:                'Result-Code' := ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH,
  803:                'Origin-Host' := _,
  804:                'Origin-Realm' := _,
  805:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [_]}]}]
  806:         = call(Config, Req).
  807: 
  808: %% Send a request containing 5xxx errors that the server rejects with
  809: %% 3xxx.
  810: send_invalid_reject(Config) ->
  811:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?USER_MOVED}],
  812: 
  813:     ?answer_message(?TOO_BUSY)
  814:         = call(Config, Req).
  815: 
  816: %% Send an STR containing a known AVP, but one that's not expected and
  817: %% that sets the M-bit.
  818: send_unexpected_mandatory(Config) ->
  819:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  820: 
  821:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  822:                'Result-Code' := ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED}]
  823:         = call(Config, Req).
  824: 
  825: %% Send something long that will be fragmented by TCP.
  826: send_long(Config) ->
  827:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  828:                   {'User-Name', [binary:copy(<<$X>>, 1 bsl 20)]}],
  829:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  830:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  831:         = call(Config, Req).
  832: 
  833: %% Send something longer than the configure incoming_maxlen.
  834: send_maxlen(Config) ->
  835:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  836:                   {'User-Name', [binary:copy(<<$X>>, 1 bsl 21)]}],
  837:     {timeout, _} = call(Config, Req).
  838: 
  839: %% Send something for which pick_peer finds no suitable peer.
  840: send_nopeer(Config) ->
  841:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  842:     {error, no_connection} = call(Config, Req, [{extra, [?EXTRA]}]).
  843: 
  844: %% Send something on an unconfigured application.
  845: send_noapp(Config) ->
  846:     #group{client_service = CN}
  847:         = group(Config),
  848:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  849:     {error, no_connection} = diameter:call(CN, unknown_alias, Req).
  850: 
  851: %% Send something that's discarded by prepare_request.
  852: send_discard(Config) ->
  853:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  854:     {error, unprepared} = call(Config, Req).
  855: 
  856: %% Send with a disjunctive filter.
  857: send_any_1(Config) ->
  858:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  859:     {error, no_connection} = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {any, []}}]).
  860: send_any_2(Config) ->
  861:     #group{server_service = SN}
  862:         = group(Config),
  863:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  864:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, "unknown.org")]}],
  865:     ?answer_message(?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER)
  866:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {first, [{all, [host, realm]},
  867:                                                realm]}}]).
  868: 
  869: %% Send with a conjunctive filter.
  870: send_all_1(Config) ->
  871:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  872:     Realm = lists:foldr(fun(C,A) -> [C,A] end, [], ?REALM),
  873:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  874:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  875:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [{host, any},
  876:                                              {realm, Realm}]}}]).
  877: send_all_2(Config) ->
  878:     #group{server_service = SN}
  879:         = group(Config),
  880:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  881:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, "unknown.org")]}],
  882:     {error, no_connection}
  883:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  884: 
  885: %% Timeout before the server manages an answer.
  886: send_timeout(Config) ->
  887:     Req = ['RAR', {'Re-Auth-Request-Type', ?AUTHORIZE_ONLY}],
  888:     {timeout, _} = call(Config, Req, [{timeout, 1000}]).
  889: 
  890: %% Explicitly answer with an answer-message and ensure that we
  891: %% received the Session-Id.
  892: send_error(Config) ->
  893:     Req = ['RAR', {'Re-Auth-Request-Type', ?AUTHORIZE_AUTHENTICATE}],
  894:     ?answer_message([_], ?TOO_BUSY)
  895:         = call(Config, Req).
  896: 
  897: %% Send a request with the detached option and receive it as a message
  898: %% from handle_answer instead.
  899: send_detach(Config) ->
  900:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  901:     Ref = make_ref(),
  902:     ok = call(Config, Req, [{extra, [{self(), Ref}]}, detach]),
  903:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  904:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  905:         = receive {Ref, T} -> T end.
  906: 
  907: %% Send a request which can't be encoded and expect {error, encode}.
  908: send_encode_error(Config) ->
  909:     {error, encode} = call(Config, ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', huh}]).
  910: 
  911: %% Send with filtering and expect success.
  912: send_destination_1(Config) ->
  913:     #group{server_service = SN}
  914:         = group(Config),
  915:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  916:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, ?REALM)]}],
  917:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  918:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  919:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  920: send_destination_2(Config) ->
  921:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  922:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  923:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  924:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  925: 
  926: %% Send with filtering on and expect failure when specifying an
  927: %% unknown host or realm.
  928: send_destination_3(Config) ->
  929:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  930:                   {'Destination-Realm', <<"unknown.org">>}],
  931:     {error, no_connection}
  932:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  933: send_destination_4(Config) ->
  934:     #group{server_service = SN}
  935:         = group(Config),
  936:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  937:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, ["unknown.org"])]}],
  938:     {error, no_connection}
  939:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  940: 
  941: %% Send without filtering and expect an error answer when specifying
  942: %% an unknown host or realm.
  943: send_destination_5(Config) ->
  944:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  945:                   {'Destination-Realm', [<<"unknown.org">>]}],
  946:     ?answer_message(?REALM_NOT_SERVED)
  947:         = call(Config, Req).
  948: send_destination_6(Config) ->
  949:     #group{server_service = SN}
  950:         = group(Config),
  951:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  952:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, "unknown.org")]}],
  953:     ?answer_message(?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER)
  954:         = call(Config, Req).
  955: 
  956: %% Send unknown host in diameter_packet with filtering and expect error.
  957: send_destination_7(Config) ->
  958:     #group{client_service = CN,
  959:            client_dict = Dict0}
  960:         = group(Config),
  961:     Name = proplists:get_value(testcase, Config),
  962:     Svc = ?util:unique_string(),
  963:     SN = [$S | Svc],
  964:     Req =
  965:         #diameter_packet{msg = ['STR' |
  966:                                 #{'Termination-Cause' => ?LOGOUT,
  967:                                   'Destination-Host' => [?HOST(SN, ?REALM)]}]},
  968:     {error, no_connection} =
  969:         diameter:call(CN,
  970:                       Dict0,
  971:                       Req,
  972:                       [{extra, [Name, diameter_lib:now()]},
  973:                        {filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  974: 
  975: %% Specify an invalid option and expect failure.
  976: send_bad_option_1(Config) ->
  977:     send_bad_option(Config, x).
  978: send_bad_option_2(Config) ->
  979:     send_bad_option(Config, {extra, false}).
  980: 
  981: send_bad_option(Config, Opt) ->
  982:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  983:     try call(Config, Req, [Opt]) of
  984:         T -> erlang:error({?MODULE, ?LINE, T})
  985:     catch
  986:         error: _ -> ok
  987:     end.
  988: 
  989: %% Specify an invalid filter and expect no matching peers.
  990: send_bad_filter_1(Config) ->
  991:     send_bad_filter(Config, {all, none}).
  992: send_bad_filter_2(Config) ->
  993:     send_bad_filter(Config, {host, x}).
  994: send_bad_filter_3(Config) ->
  995:     send_bad_filter(Config, {eval, fun() -> true end}).
  996: send_bad_filter_4(Config) ->
  997:     send_bad_filter(Config, {eval, {?MODULE, not_exported, []}}).
  998: 
  999: send_bad_filter(Config, F) ->
 1000:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
 1001:     {error, no_connection} = call(Config, Req, [{filter, F}]).
 1002: 
 1003: %% Specify multiple filter options and expect them be conjunctive.
 1004: send_multiple_filters_1(Config) ->
 1005:     Fun = fun(#diameter_caps{}) -> true end,
 1006:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
 1007:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
 1008:         = send_multiple_filters(Config, [host, {eval, Fun}]).
 1009: send_multiple_filters_2(Config) ->
 1010:     E = {erlang, is_tuple, []},
 1011:     {error, no_connection}
 1012:         = send_multiple_filters(Config, [realm, {neg, {eval, E}}]).
 1013: send_multiple_filters_3(Config) ->
 1014:     E1 = [fun(#diameter_caps{}, ok) -> true end, ok],
 1015:     E2 = {erlang, is_tuple, []},
 1016:     E3 = {erlang, is_record, [diameter_caps]},
 1017:     E4 = [{erlang, is_record, []}, diameter_caps],
 1018:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
 1019:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
 1020:         = send_multiple_filters(Config, [{eval, E} || E <- [E1,E2,E3,E4]]).
 1021: 
 1022: send_multiple_filters(Config, Fs) ->
 1023:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
 1024:     call(Config, Req, [{filter, F} || F <- Fs]).
 1025: 
 1026: %% Ensure that we can pass a request in any form to diameter:call/4,
 1027: %% only the return value from the prepare_request callback being
 1028: %% significant.
 1029: send_anything(Config) ->
 1030:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
 1031:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
 1032:         = call(Config, anything).
 1033: 
 1034: %% ===========================================================================
 1035: 
 1036: group(#group{} = Rec) ->
 1037:     Rec;
 1038: group(Config) ->
 1039:     #group{} = proplists:get_value(group, Config).
 1040: 
 1041: string(V, Config) ->
 1042:     #group{strings = B} = group(Config),
 1043:     decode(V,B).
 1044: 
 1045: decode(S, true)
 1046:   when is_list(S) ->
 1047:     S;
 1048: decode(B, false)
 1049:   when is_binary(B) ->
 1050:     binary_to_list(B).
 1051: 
 1052: call(Config, Req) ->
 1053:     call(Config, Req, []).
 1054: 
 1055: call(Config, Req, Opts) ->
 1056:     Name = proplists:get_value(testcase, Config),
 1057:     #group{encoding = Enc,
 1058:            client_service = CN,
 1059:            client_dict = Dict0}
 1060:         = group(Config),
 1061:     diameter:call(CN,
 1062:                   dict(Req, Dict0),
 1063:                   msg(Req, Enc, Dict0),
 1064:                   [{extra, [Name, diameter_lib:now()]} | Opts]).
 1065: 
 1066: origin({D,E}) ->
 1067:     4*decode(D) + encode(E);
 1068: 
 1069: origin(N) ->
 1070:     {decode(N bsr 2), encode(N rem 4)}.
 1071: 
 1072: %% Map atoms. The atoms are part of (constructed) group names, so it's
 1073: %% good that they're readable.
 1074: 
 1075: decode(record) -> 0;
 1076: decode(list)   -> 1;
 1077: decode(map)    -> 2;
 1078: decode(none)   -> 3;
 1079: decode(record_from_map) -> 4;
 1080: decode(0) -> record;
 1081: decode(1) -> list;
 1082: decode(2) -> map;
 1083: decode(3) -> none;
 1084: decode(4) -> record_from_map.
 1085: 
 1086: encode(record) -> 0;
 1087: encode(list)   -> 1;
 1088: encode(map)    -> 2;
 1089: encode(0) -> record;
 1090: encode(1) -> list;
 1091: encode(2) -> map.
 1092: 
 1093: msg([H|_] = Msg, record = E, diameter_gen_base_rfc3588)
 1094:   when H == 'ACR';
 1095:        H == 'ACA' ->
 1096:     msg(Msg, E, diameter_gen_base_accounting);
 1097: 
 1098: msg([H|_] = Msg, record = E, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733)
 1099:   when H == 'ACR';
 1100:        H == 'ACA' ->
 1101:     msg(Msg, E, diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733);
 1102: 
 1103: msg([H|T], record, Dict) ->
 1104:     Dict:'#new-'(Dict:msg2rec(H), T);
 1105: 
 1106: msg([H|As], map, _)
 1107:   when is_list(As) ->
 1108:     [H | maps:from_list(As)];
 1109: 
 1110: msg(Msg, _, _) ->
 1111:     Msg.
 1112: 
 1113: to_map(#diameter_packet{msg = [_MsgName | Avps] = Msg},
 1114:        #group{server_decoding = map})
 1115:   when is_map(Avps) ->
 1116:     Msg;
 1117: 
 1118: to_map(#diameter_packet{msg = [MsgName | Avps]},
 1119:        #group{server_decoding = list}) ->
 1120:     [MsgName | maps:from_list(Avps)];
 1121: 
 1122: to_map(#diameter_packet{header = H, msg = Rec},
 1123:        #group{server_decoding = D})
 1124:   when D == record;
 1125:        D == record_from_map ->
 1126:     rec_to_map(Rec, dict(H));
 1127: 
 1128: %% No record decode: do it ourselves.
 1129: to_map(#diameter_packet{header = H,
 1130:                         msg = Name,
 1131:                         bin = Bin},
 1132:       #group{server_decoding = none,
 1133:              strings = B}) ->
 1134:     Opts = #{decode_format => map,
 1135:              string_decode => B,
 1136:              avp_dictionaries => [diameter_gen_doic_rfc7683],
 1137:              strict_mbit => true,
 1138:              rfc => 6733},
 1139:     #diameter_packet{msg = [MsgName | _Map] = Msg}
 1140:         = diameter_codec:decode(dict(H), Opts, Bin),
 1141:     {MsgName, _} = {Name, Msg},  %% assert
 1142:     Msg.
 1143: 
 1144: dict(#diameter_header{application_id = Id,
 1145:                       cmd_code = Code}) ->
 1146:     if Id == 1 ->
 1147:             nas4005;
 1148:        Code == 271 ->
 1149:             diameter_gen_base_accounting;
 1150:        true ->
 1151:             diameter_gen_base_rfc3588
 1152:     end.
 1153: 
 1154: rec_to_map(Rec, Dict) ->
 1155:     [R | Vs] = Dict:'#get-'(Rec),
 1156:     [Dict:rec2msg(R) | maps:from_list([T || {_,V} = T <- Vs,
 1157:                                             V /= undefined,
 1158:                                             V /= []])].
 1159: 
 1160: appdict(rfc4005) ->
 1161:     nas4005;
 1162: appdict(D) ->
 1163:     dict0(D).
 1164: 
 1165: dict0(D) ->
 1166:     ?A("diameter_gen_base_" ++ ?L(D)).
 1167: 
 1168: dict(Msg, Dict) ->
 1169:     d(name(Msg), Dict).
 1170: 
 1171: d(N, nas4005 = D) ->
 1172:     if N == {list, 'answer-message'};
 1173:        N == {map, 'answer-message'};
 1174:        N == {record, 'diameter_base_answer-message'} ->
 1175:             diameter_gen_base_rfc3588;
 1176:        true ->
 1177:             D
 1178:     end;
 1179: d(N, Dict0)
 1180:   when N == {list, 'ACR'};
 1181:        N == {list, 'ACA'};
 1182:        N == {map, 'ACR'};
 1183:        N == {map, 'ACA'};
 1184:        N == {record, diameter_base_accounting_ACR};
 1185:        N == {record, diameter_base_accounting_ACA} ->
 1186:     acct(Dict0);
 1187: d(_, Dict0) ->
 1188:     Dict0.
 1189: 
 1190: acct(diameter_gen_base_rfc3588) ->
 1191:     diameter_gen_base_accounting;
 1192: acct(diameter_gen_base_rfc6733) ->
 1193:     diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733.
 1194: 
 1195: %% Set only values that aren't already.
 1196: 
 1197: set(_, [N | As], Vs) ->
 1198:     [N | if is_map(As) ->
 1199:                  maps:merge(maps:from_list(Vs), As);
 1200:             is_list(As) ->
 1201:                  Vs ++ As
 1202:          end];
 1203: 
 1204: set(#group{client_dict = Dict0} = _Group, Rec, Vs) ->
 1205:     Dict = dict(Rec, Dict0),
 1206:     lists:foldl(fun({F,_} = FV, A) ->
 1207:                         reset(Dict, Dict:'#get-'(F, A), FV, A)
 1208:                 end,
 1209:                 Rec,
 1210:                 Vs).
 1211: 
 1212: reset(Dict, E, FV, Rec)
 1213:   when E == undefined;
 1214:        E == [] ->
 1215:     Dict:'#set-'(FV, Rec);
 1216: 
 1217: reset(_, _, _, Rec) ->
 1218:     Rec.
 1219: 
 1220: %% ===========================================================================
 1221: %% diameter callbacks
 1222: 
 1223: %% peer_up/4
 1224: 
 1225: peer_up(_SvcName, _Peer, State, _Group) ->
 1226:     State.
 1227: 
 1228: %% peer_down/3
 1229: 
 1230: peer_down(_SvcName, _Peer, State, _Group) ->
 1231:     State.
 1232: 
 1233: %% pick_peer/7-8
 1234: 
 1235: pick_peer(Peers, _, [$C|_], _State, Group, Name, _)
 1236:   when Name /= send_detach ->
 1237:     find(Group, Peers).
 1238: 
 1239: pick_peer(_Peers, _, [$C|_], _State, _Group, send_nopeer, _, ?EXTRA) ->
 1240:     false;
 1241: 
 1242: pick_peer(Peers, _, [$C|_], _State, Group, send_detach, _, {_,_}) ->
 1243:     find(Group, Peers).
 1244: 
 1245: find(#group{encoding = E,
 1246:             client_service = CN,
 1247:             server_decoding = D},
 1248:      [_|_] = Peers) ->
 1249:     Id = {D,E},
 1250:     [P] = [P || P <- Peers, id(Id, P, CN)],
 1251:     {ok, P}.
 1252: 
 1253: id(Id, {Pid, _Caps}, SvcName) ->
 1254:     [{ref, _}, {type, _}, {options, Opts} | _]
 1255:         = diameter:service_info(SvcName, Pid),
 1256:     lists:member({id, Id}, Opts).
 1257: 
 1258: %% prepare_request/6-7
 1259: prepare_request(_Pkt, [$C|_], {_Ref, _Caps}, _, send_discard, _) ->
 1260:     {discard, unprepared};
 1261: 
 1262: prepare_request(Pkt, [$C|_], {_Ref, Caps}, Group, Name, _) ->
 1263:     {send, prepare(Pkt, Caps, Name, Group)}.
 1264: 
 1265: prepare_request(Pkt, [$C|_], {_Ref, Caps}, Group, send_detach, _, _) ->
 1266:     {eval_packet, {send, prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group)}, [fun log/2, detach]}.
 1267: 
 1268: log(#diameter_packet{bin = Bin} = P, T)
 1269:   when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1270:     io:format("~p: ~p~n", [T,P]).
 1271: 
 1272: %% prepare/4
 1273: 
 1274: prepare(Pkt, Caps, N, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group)
 1275:   when N == send_unknown_short_mandatory;
 1276:        N == send_unknown_short ->
 1277:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1278: 
 1279:     #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{length = L},
 1280:                      bin = Bin}
 1281:         = E
 1282:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1283: 
 1284:     %% Find the unknown AVP data at the end of the message and alter
 1285:     %% its length header.
 1286: 
 1287:     {Padding, [17|_]} = lists:splitwith(fun(C) -> C == 0 end,
 1288:                                        lists:reverse(binary_to_list(Bin))),
 1289: 
 1290:     Offset = L - length(Padding) - 4,
 1291:     <<H:Offset/binary, Len:24, T/binary>> = Bin,
 1292:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary, (Len+9):24, T/binary>>};
 1293: 
 1294: prepare(Pkt, Caps, N, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group)
 1295:   when N == send_long_avp_length;
 1296:        N == send_short_avp_length;
 1297:        N == send_zero_avp_length ->
 1298:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1299:     %% Second last AVP in our STR is Auth-Application-Id of type
 1300:     %% Unsigned32: set AVP Length to a value other than 12 and place
 1301:     %% it last in the message (so as not to mess with Termination-Cause).
 1302:     #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{length = L},
 1303:                      bin = B}
 1304:         = E
 1305:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1306:     Offset = L - 24,  %% to Auth-Application-Id
 1307:     <<H:Offset/binary,
 1308:       Hdr:5/binary, 12:24, Data:4/binary,
 1309:       T:12/binary>>
 1310:         = B,
 1311:     AL = case N of
 1312:              send_long_avp_length  -> 13;
 1313:              send_short_avp_length -> 11;
 1314:              send_zero_avp_length  -> 0
 1315:          end,
 1316:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary,
 1317:                               T/binary,
 1318:                               Hdr/binary, AL:24, Data/binary>>};
 1319: 
 1320: prepare(Pkt, Caps, N, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group)
 1321:   when N == send_invalid_avp_length;
 1322:        N == send_invalid_reject ->
 1323:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1324:     %% Second last AVP in our STR is Auth-Application-Id of type
 1325:     %% Unsigned32: send data of length 8.
 1326:     #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{length = L},
 1327:                      bin = B0}
 1328:         = E
 1329:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1330:     Offset = L - 7 - 12,  %% to AVP Length
 1331:     <<H0:Offset/binary, 12:24, T:16/binary>> = B0,
 1332:     <<V, L:24, H/binary>> = H0,  %% assert
 1333:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<V, (L+4):24, H/binary, 16:24, 0:32, T/binary>>};
 1334: 
 1335: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unexpected_mandatory, #group{client_dict = Dict0}
 1336:                                               = Group) ->
 1337:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1338:     #diameter_packet{bin = <<V, Len:24, T/binary>>}
 1339:         = E
 1340:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1341:     {Code, Flags, undefined} = Dict0:avp_header('Proxy-State'),
 1342:     Avp = <<Code:32, Flags, 8:24>>,
 1343:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<V, (Len+8):24, T/binary, Avp/binary>>};
 1344: 
 1345: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_grouped_error, #group{client_dict = Dict0}
 1346:                                               = Group) ->
 1347:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1348:     #diameter_packet{bin = Bin}
 1349:         = E
 1350:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1351:     {Code, Flags, undefined} = Dict0:avp_header('Proxy-Info'),
 1352:     %% Find Proxy-Info by looking for its header.
 1353:     Pattern = <<Code:32, Flags, 28:24>>,
 1354:     {Offset, 8} = binary:match(Bin, Pattern),
 1355: 
 1356:     %% Extract and swap Proxy-Host/State payloads.
 1357: 
 1358:     <<H:Offset/binary,
 1359:       PI:8/binary,
 1360:       PH:5/binary,
 1361:       12:24,
 1362:       Payload:4/binary,
 1363:       PS:5/binary,
 1364:       8:24,
 1365:       T/binary>>
 1366:         = Bin,
 1367: 
 1368:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary,
 1369:                               PI/binary,
 1370:                               PH/binary,
 1371:                               8:24,
 1372:                               PS:5/binary,
 1373:                               12:24,
 1374:                               Payload/binary,
 1375:                               T/binary>>};
 1376: 
 1377: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unsupported, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group) ->
 1378:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1379:     #diameter_packet{bin = <<H:5/binary, _CmdCode:3/binary, T/binary>>}
 1380:         = E
 1381:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1382:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary, 42:24, T/binary>>};
 1383: 
 1384: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unsupported_app, #group{client_dict = Dict0}
 1385:                                          = Group) ->
 1386:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1387:     #diameter_packet{bin = <<H:8/binary, _ApplId:4/binary, T/binary>>}
 1388:         = E
 1389:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1390:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary, ?BAD_APP:32, T/binary>>};
 1391: 
 1392: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_error_bit, Group) ->
 1393:     #diameter_packet{header = Hdr} = Pkt,
 1394:     Pkt#diameter_packet{header = Hdr#diameter_header{is_error = true},
 1395:                         msg = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group)};
 1396: 
 1397: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unsupported_version, Group) ->
 1398:     #diameter_packet{header = Hdr} = Pkt,
 1399:     Pkt#diameter_packet{header = Hdr#diameter_header{version = 42},
 1400:                         msg = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group)};
 1401: 
 1402: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_anything, Group) ->
 1403:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
 1404:     prepare(Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group);
 1405: 
 1406: prepare(Pkt, Caps, _Name, Group) ->
 1407:     prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group).
 1408: 
 1409: %% prepare/3
 1410: 
 1411: prepare(#diameter_packet{msg = Req} = Pkt, Caps, Group) ->
 1412:     set(name(Req), Pkt, Caps, Group).
 1413: 
 1414: %% set/4
 1415: 
 1416: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1417:   when N == {record, diameter_base_accounting_ACR};
 1418:        N == {record, nas_ACR};
 1419:        N == {map, 'ACR'};
 1420:        N == {list, 'ACR'} ->
 1421:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
 1422:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1423:         = Caps,
 1424: 
 1425:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1426:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1427:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1428:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]}]);
 1429: 
 1430: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1431:   when N == {record, diameter_base_ASR};
 1432:        N == {record, nas_ASR};
 1433:        N == {map, 'ASR'};
 1434:        N == {list, 'ASR'} ->
 1435:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, DH},
 1436:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1437:         = Caps,
 1438:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1439:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1440:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1441:                      {'Destination-Host',  [DH]},
 1442:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]},
 1443:                      {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}]);
 1444: 
 1445: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1446:   when N == {record, diameter_base_STR};
 1447:        N == {record, nas_STR};
 1448:        N == {map, 'STR'};
 1449:        N == {list, 'STR'} ->
 1450:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
 1451:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1452:         = Caps,
 1453:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1454:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1455:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1456:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]},
 1457:                      {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}]);
 1458: 
 1459: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1460:   when N == {record, diameter_base_RAR};
 1461:        N == {record, nas_RAR};
 1462:        N == {map, 'RAR'};
 1463:        N == {list, 'RAR'} ->
 1464:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, DH},
 1465:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1466:         = Caps,
 1467:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1468:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1469:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1470:                      {'Destination-Host',  [DH]},
 1471:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]},
 1472:                      {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}]).
 1473: 
 1474: %% name/1
 1475: 
 1476: name([H|#{}]) ->
 1477:     {map, H};
 1478: 
 1479: name([H|_]) ->
 1480:     {list, H};
 1481: 
 1482: name(Rec) ->
 1483:     try
 1484:         {record, element(1, Rec)}
 1485:     catch
 1486:         error: badarg ->
 1487:             false
 1488:     end.
 1489: 
 1490: %% prepare_retransmit/6
 1491: 
 1492: prepare_retransmit(_Pkt, false, _Peer, _Group, _Name, _) ->
 1493:     discard.
 1494: 
 1495: %% handle_answer/7-8
 1496: 
 1497: handle_answer(Pkt, Req, [$C|_], Peer, Group, Name, _) ->
 1498:     answer(Pkt, Req, Peer, Name, Group).
 1499: 
 1500: handle_answer(Pkt, Req, [$C|_], Peer, Group, send_detach = Name, _, X) ->
 1501:     {Pid, Ref} = X,
 1502:     Pid ! {Ref, answer(Pkt, Req, Peer, Name, Group)}.
 1503: 
 1504: answer(Pkt, Req, _Peer, Name, #group{client_dict = Dict0}) ->
 1505:     #diameter_packet{header = H, msg = Ans, errors = Es} = Pkt,
 1506:     ApplId = app(Req, Name, Dict0),
 1507:     #diameter_header{application_id = ApplId} = H,  %% assert
 1508:     answer(Ans, Es, Name).
 1509: 
 1510: %% Missing Result-Code and inappropriate Experimental-Result-Code.
 1511: answer(Ans, Es, send_experimental_result) ->
 1512:     [{5004, #diameter_avp{name = 'Experimental-Result'}},
 1513:      {5005, #diameter_avp{name = 'Result-Code'}}]
 1514:         =  Es,
 1515:     Ans;
 1516: 
 1517: %% An inappropriate E-bit results in a decode error ...
 1518: answer(Ans, Es, send_bad_answer) ->
 1519:     [{5004, #diameter_avp{name = 'Result-Code'}} | _] = Es,
 1520:     Ans;
 1521: 
 1522: %% ... while other errors are reflected in Failed-AVP.
 1523: answer(Ans, [], _) ->
 1524:     Ans.
 1525: 
 1526: app(_, send_unsupported_app, _) ->
 1527:     ?BAD_APP;
 1528: app(Req, _, Dict0) ->
 1529:     Dict = dict(Req, Dict0),
 1530:     Dict:id().
 1531: 
 1532: %% handle_error/7
 1533: 
 1534: handle_error(timeout = Reason, _Req, [$C|_], _Peer, _, _, Time) ->
 1535:     Now = diameter_lib:now(),
 1536:     {Reason, {diameter_lib:timestamp(Time),
 1537:               diameter_lib:timestamp(Now),
 1538:               diameter_lib:micro_diff(Now, Time)}};
 1539: 
 1540: handle_error(Reason, _Req, [$C|_], _Peer, _, _, _Time) ->
 1541:     {error, Reason}.
 1542: 
 1543: %% handle_request/4
 1544: 
 1545: %% Note that diameter will set Result-Code and Failed-AVPs if
 1546: %% #diameter_packet.errors is non-null.
 1547: 
 1548: handle_request(#diameter_packet{header = H, avps = As}
 1549:                = Pkt,
 1550:                _,
 1551:                {_Ref, Caps},
 1552:                #group{encoding = E,
 1553:                       server_decoding = D}
 1554:                = Grp) ->
 1555:     #diameter_header{end_to_end_id = EI,
 1556:                      hop_by_hop_id = HI}
 1557:         = H,
 1558:     {V,B} = ?CLIENT_MASK,
 1559:     V = EI bsr B,  %% assert
 1560:     V = HI bsr B,  %%
 1561:     #diameter_caps{origin_state_id = {_,[Id]}} = Caps,
 1562:     {D,E} = T = origin(Id),  %% assert
 1563:     wrap(T, H, request(to_map(Pkt, Grp), [H|As], Caps)).
 1564: 
 1565: wrap(Id, H, {Tag, Action, Post}) ->
 1566:     {Tag, wrap(Id, H, Action), Post};
 1567: 
 1568: wrap(_, _, {reply, [#diameter_header{} | _]} = T) ->
 1569:     T;
 1570: 
 1571: wrap({_,E}, H, {reply, Ans}) ->
 1572:     Msg = base_to_nas(msg(Ans, E, diameter_gen_base_rfc3588), H),
 1573:     {reply, wrap(Msg)};
 1574: 
 1575: wrap(_, _, T) ->
 1576:     T.
 1577: 
 1578: %% Randomly wrap the answer in a diameter_packet.
 1579: 
 1580: wrap(#diameter_packet{} = Pkt) ->
 1581:     Pkt;
 1582: 
 1583: wrap(Msg) ->
 1584:     case rand:uniform(2) of
 1585:         1 -> #diameter_packet{msg = Msg};
 1586:         2 -> Msg
 1587:     end.
 1588: 
 1589: %% base_to_nas/2
 1590: 
 1591: base_to_nas(#diameter_packet{msg = Msg} = Pkt, H) ->
 1592:     Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = base_to_nas(Msg, H)};
 1593: 
 1594: base_to_nas(Rec, #diameter_header{application_id = 1})
 1595:   when is_tuple(Rec), not ?is_record(Rec, 'diameter_base_answer-message') ->
 1596:     D = case element(1, Rec) of
 1597:             diameter_base_accounting_ACA ->
 1598:                 diameter_gen_base_accounting;
 1599:             _ ->
 1600:                 diameter_gen_base_rfc3588
 1601:         end,
 1602:     [R | Values] = D:'#get-'(Rec),
 1603:     "diameter_base_" ++ N = ?L(R),
 1604:     Name = ?A("nas_" ++ if N == "accounting_ACA" ->
 1605:                                 "ACA";
 1606:                            true ->
 1607:                                 N
 1608:                         end),
 1609:     nas4005:'#new-'([Name | Values]);
 1610: 
 1611: base_to_nas(Msg, _) ->
 1612:     Msg.
 1613: 
 1614: %% request/3
 1615: 
 1616: %% send_experimental_result
 1617: request(['ACR' | #{'Accounting-Record-Number' := 5}],
 1618:         [Hdr | Avps],
 1619:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1620:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1621:     [H,R|T] = [A || N <- ['Origin-Host',
 1622:                           'Origin-Realm',
 1623:                           'Session-Id',
 1624:                           'Accounting-Record-Type',
 1625:                           'Accounting-Record-Number'],
 1626:                     #diameter_avp{} = A
 1627:                         <- [lists:keyfind(N, #diameter_avp.name, Avps)]],
 1628:     Ans = [Hdr#diameter_header{is_request = false},
 1629:            H#diameter_avp{data = OH},
 1630:            R#diameter_avp{data = OR},
 1631:            #diameter_avp{name = 'Experimental-Result',
 1632:                          code = 297,
 1633:                          need_encryption = false,
 1634:                          data = [#diameter_avp{data = {?DIAMETER_DICT_COMMON,
 1635:                                                        'Vendor-Id',
 1636:                                                        123}},
 1637:                                  #diameter_avp{data
 1638:                                                = {?DIAMETER_DICT_COMMON,
 1639:                                                   'Experimental-Result-Code',
 1640:                                                   3987}}]}
 1641:            | T],
 1642:     {reply, Ans};
 1643: 
 1644: request(Msg, _Avps, Caps) ->
 1645:     request(Msg, Caps).
 1646: 
 1647: %% request/2
 1648: 
 1649: %% send_nok
 1650: request(['ACR' | #{'Accounting-Record-Number' := 0}],
 1651:         _) ->
 1652:     {eval_packet, {protocol_error, ?INVALID_AVP_BITS}, [fun log/2, invalid]};
 1653: 
 1654: %% send_bad_answer
 1655: request(['ACR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId,
 1656:                    'Accounting-Record-Type' := RT,
 1657:                    'Accounting-Record-Number' := 2 = RN}],
 1658:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1659:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1660:     Ans = ['ACA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1661:                   {'Session-Id', SId},
 1662:                   {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1663:                   {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1664:                   {'Accounting-Record-Type', RT},
 1665:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', RN}],
 1666: 
 1667:     {reply, #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{is_error = true},%% NOT
 1668:                              msg = Ans}};
 1669: 
 1670: %% send_eval
 1671: request(['ACR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId,
 1672:                    'Accounting-Record-Type' := RT,
 1673:                    'Accounting-Record-Number' := 3 = RN}],
 1674:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1675:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1676:     Ans = ['ACA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1677:                   {'Session-Id', SId},
 1678:                   {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1679:                   {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1680:                   {'Accounting-Record-Type', RT},
 1681:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', RN}],
 1682:     {eval, {reply, Ans}, {erlang, now, []}};
 1683: 
 1684: %% send_ok
 1685: request(['ACR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId,
 1686:                    'Accounting-Record-Type' := RT,
 1687:                    'Accounting-Record-Number' := 1 = RN}],
 1688:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1689:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1690:     {reply, ['ACA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1691:                     {'Session-Id', SId},
 1692:                     {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1693:                     {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1694:                     {'Accounting-Record-Type', RT},
 1695:                     {'Accounting-Record-Number', RN}]};
 1696: 
 1697: %% send_protocol_error
 1698: request(['ACR' | #{'Accounting-Record-Number' := 4}],
 1699:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1700:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1701:     %% Include a DOIC AVP that will be encoded/decoded because of
 1702:     %% avp_dictionaries config.
 1703:     OLR = #{'OC-Sequence-Number' => 1,
 1704:             'OC-Report-Type' => 0,  %% HOST_REPORT
 1705:             'OC-Reduction-Percentage' => [25],
 1706:             'OC-Validity-Duration' => [60],
 1707:             'AVP' => [{'OC-Supported-Features', []}]},
 1708:     %% Include a NAS Failed-AVP AVP that will only be decoded under
 1709:     %% that application. Encode as 'AVP' since RFC 3588 doesn't list
 1710:     %% Failed-AVP in the answer-message grammar while RFC 6733 does.
 1711:     NP = #diameter_avp{data = {nas4005, 'NAS-Port', 44}},
 1712:     FR = #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision', value = 12}, %% M=0
 1713:     AP = #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period', value = 13}, %% M=1
 1714:     Failed = #diameter_avp{data = {diameter_gen_base_rfc3588,
 1715:                                    'Failed-AVP',
 1716:                                    [{'AVP', [NP,FR,AP]}]}},
 1717:     Ans = ['answer-message', {'Result-Code', ?TOO_BUSY},
 1718:                              {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1719:                              {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1720:                              {'AVP', [{'OC-OLR', OLR}, Failed]}],
 1721:     {reply, Ans};
 1722: 
 1723: %% send_proxy_info
 1724: request(['ASR' | #{'Proxy-Info' := _}],
 1725:         _) ->
 1726:     {protocol_error, 3999};
 1727: 
 1728: request(['ASR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId} = Avps],
 1729:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1730:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1731:     {reply, ['ASA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1732:                     {'Session-Id', SId},
 1733:                     {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1734:                     {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1735:                     {'AVP', maps:get('AVP', Avps, [])}]};
 1736: 
 1737: %% send_invalid_reject
 1738: request(['STR' | #{'Termination-Cause' := ?USER_MOVED}],
 1739:         _Caps) ->
 1740:     {protocol_error, ?TOO_BUSY};
 1741: 
 1742: %% send_noreply
 1743: request(['STR' | #{'Termination-Cause' := T}],
 1744:         _Caps)
 1745:   when T /= ?LOGOUT ->
 1746:     discard;
 1747: 
 1748: %% send_destination_5
 1749: request(['STR' | #{'Destination-Realm' := R}],
 1750:         #diameter_caps{origin_realm = {OR, _}})
 1751:   when R /= undefined, R /= OR ->
 1752:     {protocol_error, ?REALM_NOT_SERVED};
 1753: 
 1754: %% send_destination_6
 1755: request(['STR' | #{'Destination-Host' := [H]}],
 1756:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _}})
 1757:   when H /= OH ->
 1758:     {protocol_error, ?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER};
 1759: 
 1760: request(['STR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId}],
 1761:         #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
 1762:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1763:     {reply, ['STA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1764:                     {'Session-Id', SId},
 1765:                     {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1766:                     {'Origin-Realm', OR}]};
 1767: 
 1768: %% send_error/send_timeout
 1769: request(['RAR' | #{}], _Caps) ->
 1770:     receive after 2000 -> {protocol_error, ?TOO_BUSY} end.
 1771: 
 1772: %% message/3
 1773: %%
 1774: %% Limit the number of messages received. More can be received if read
 1775: %% in the same packet.
 1776: 
 1777: message(recv = D, {[_], Bin}, N) ->
 1778:     message(D, Bin, N);
 1779: message(Dir, #diameter_packet{bin = Bin}, N) ->
 1780:     message(Dir, Bin, N);
 1781: 
 1782: %% incoming request
 1783: message(recv, <<_:32, 1:1, _/bits>> = Bin, N) ->
 1784:     [Bin, N < 16, fun ?MODULE:message/3, N+1];
 1785: 
 1786: %% incoming answer
 1787: message(recv, Bin, _) ->
 1788:     [Bin];
 1789: 
 1790: %% outgoing
 1791: message(send, Bin, _) ->
 1792:     [Bin];
 1793: 
 1794: %% sent request
 1795: message(ack, <<_:32, 1:1, _/bits>>, _) ->
 1796:     [];
 1797: 
 1798: %% sent answer or discarded request
 1799: message(ack, _, N) ->
 1800:     [N =< 16, fun ?MODULE:message/3, N-1].
 1801: 
 1802: %% ------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1803: 
 1804: compile_and_load() ->
 1805:     Path = hd([P || H <- [[here(), ".."], [code:lib_dir(diameter)]],
 1806:                     P <- [filename:join(H ++ ["examples",
 1807:                                               "dict",
 1808:                                               "rfc4005_nas.dia"])],
 1809:                     {ok, _} <- [file:read_file_info(P)]]),
 1810:     Opts = [return,
 1811:             forms,
 1812:             {name, "nas4005"},
 1813:             {prefix, "nas"},
 1814:             {inherits, "common/diameter_gen_base_rfc3588"}],
 1815:     {ok, [Forms]} = diameter_make:codec(Path, Opts),
 1816:     {ok, nas4005, Bin, []} = compile:forms(Forms, [debug_info, return]),
 1817:     {module, nas4005} = code:load_binary(nas4005, "nas4005", Bin).
 1818: 
 1819: here() ->
 1820:     filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)).
